WorkItem.Description: Whenever I select "Chart: Gems > Normal" or "Chart: Gems > Meta" in order to get a chart of gems listed by rating, Rawr deletes all but a few gems in those categories. I first noticed this in the Moonkin model, but I haven't checked the other models yet so it may be affecting them as well.

Comments.Message: ...huh? How exactly are you deleting in gems or seeing gems being delete, or anything? Are you perhaps filtering out gems? Filters are in the top right.

Unless the filters apply to every single screen in the entire program all at once, then no, they aren't being filtered. The application works as normal until I try to view gems as items in the large pane on the right-hand side, and then only a select handful (usually old BC gems) actually show up. After doing this, whenever I try to change or add a gem to a socketed item, the only gems that show up are the few that were listed in that window. It deletes literally ALL of the meta gems in the list, every single time like clockwork.

I tested this 5 or 6 times to make sure that's what's happening, and every time deleted the folder completely and unzipped a new install fresh from this website. I noticed that the ItemCache folder gets smaller after the gems go missing, which seems to indicate that they are indeed being deleted and not just filtered.

I've seen this happen too.   All of the items and all of the gems except those you have marked with "<>" suddenly vanish!  No filtering, no manual deleting.  It seems to be related to adding default gemmings (maybe).

That would make sense, since that happens to be exactly what I was doing right before I switched to view the gems in the right-hand pane and noticed they were all missing. Perhaps it is the default gemmings interface that is deleting them?
Filters do apply to all charts. Can you please enable all filters, so we know that's not involved in this, and then tell us what exactly the problem is?

I found that if I toggle Tools->Refine Types->Offhand/Misc->Misc off, all the gems disappear from the charts.

This is with v2.1.9. I'm using the Healadin module primarily, but I can replicate it with others (tried Bear,  Holy Priest, and Shadow Priest kind of arbitrarily.)
